description:
Live births

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12612 Birth statistics

Definition:
The difference between live-born and stillborn children is
laid down in the "Ordinance Implementing the Civil Status
Act (PStV)". According to these provisions, live-born
children are newborns whose heart beat, whose umbilical cord
pulsed or whose natural lung respiration commenced after
separation from the mothers body.
Until the end of 1957, children whose natural lung
respiration had commenced were regarded as live born.

name: Live births
